dd14835d-d988-4cfd-aa39-881570a44d02: A incense synthesizer learns a number of alchemical tricks, called incenses, which grant ally powers or weaken foes. At 3rd level, a incense synthesizer learns one incense. At 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th and 18th level, the incense synthesizer learns new incense. A incense synthesizer cannot select a incense more than once unless noted otherwise.
af1e6760-027b-4f23-a3a6-9a10572bf240: A metamorph adds {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
a13b5ca3-9d29-4823-b30a-7be32eef12c1:
A metamorph gains the ability to transform herself into another form. The effect lasts for 1 hour per metamorph's alchemist level, or until she changes back. Changing form (to another form or back) is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The metamorph is fatigued for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} each time she changes shape.
A metamorph can use this ability twice per day at 4th level and an additional time per day every 2 alchemist levels thereafter, for a total of ten times at 20th level.
This ability functions as beast shape I at 4th level, as beast shape II at 9th level, as beast shape III at 11th level, as beast shape IV or dragonkind I at 13th level, and as dragonkind II at 15th level.
This ability replaces alchemy (which also includes bombs, extracts, and mutagen) and Throw Anything.
577abad3-a110-4ea4-a97e-2d929226b17a: A mutagen that gives the alchemist a +4 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.

fbc16c9f-f3dd-4cb8-82af-bb471738ae70: A vivisectionist studies bodies to better understand their function. Unlike a chirurgeon, a vivisectionist's goals are not related to healing, but rather to experimentation and knowledge that most people would consider evil.
da3fc98f-788a-4ad7-bd59-7201b22134c2: Alchemist is an unusual class that employs a vast arsenal of handmade potions, extracts, elixirs, and even bombs. Bombs are a ranged, area of effect weapon — the alchemist's main weapon. They learn a lot of arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, but instead of casting them normally, an alchemist prepares them as extracts.
3969749c-e59d-42ff-b5cb-78d9bb78f6c6: Alchemists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and bombs. They are also proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
412b492b-1973-488c-8be8-44e95383f515: Alchemists are scientists who wield magic, but instead of casting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, prepare them as a special kind of potions — extracts. Most extracts provide some kind of empowerment. After some advancement, an alchemist can gain the ability to share their extracts with their allies.
85bfcc89-0352-4490-bfdd-206a81c529fe: All alchemists gain the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat at 1st level. An alchemist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} done with splash weapons, including the splash damage if any.
717513b8-5711-4a9f-a523-24cca2a82793:
An affected ally receives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
You can gain Rallying Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
6d0407db-016f-4d9a-b338-199f8f8860da:
An affected ally receives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
You can gain Clarifying Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.

You can gain Neutralizing Incense up to 3 times. Its effects stack.
52dba4af-211b-499f-8961-6c4bb7ef7689:
An affected ally receives additional a +1 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
You can gain Improved Incense up to 2 times. Its effects stack.
7d48345f-88ce-44e9-a820-d91d197c7952: An affected ally receives {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance).
7304d567-6995-4e09-9067-21e615ee54e0:

330d909b-21c6-4346-b0cc-72feb2a7e296:

cdd34265-aa12-4e0c-90a2-9eaee77c801d: An alchemist who studies anatomy and uses this knowledge to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} is a chirurgeon.
a61b974a-0664-418f-a814-adf8a69cfddd: An alchemist with this discovery can quickly create enough bombs to throw more than one in a single {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The alchemist can prepare and throw additional bombs as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} if his {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} is high enough to grant him additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. This functions just like a full-attack with a ranged weapon.
20530651-0d00-44ca-a75a-ba8340389dbc: Any potion that the alchemist drinks functions at a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}.
ae461d9f-eed0-4f13-bd28-152699889776: Any potion that the alchemist drinks functions at twice its normal duration, as if affected by the Extend Spell metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
8ddcad55-ed16-4c66-bbac-9dfff4b94737: Any undead creatures and evil outsiders who enter the area of incense fog must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become alchemically nauseated and alchemically sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If the save succeeds, the opponent is only alchemically sickened for 1d4 rounds. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
aeaa8d6b-cf2c-4c6b-a37b-0e86c102023a: Any undead creatures and evil outsiders who enter the area of incense fog must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become alchemically sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
a685e995-5b10-4bd1-b25a-d01db7490b41: At 10th level, a chirurgeon adds breath of life to his formula book as a 4th-level extract. His infused curative ability applies to this extract.
a50099a8-c011-4b5c-8895-d952637dfd77: At 10th level, a grenadier's bombs become particularly overwhelming when they explode. Whenever a grenadier scores a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} with a bomb, the creature directly struck by that bomb is staggered for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equals the bomb's Reflex save DC to avoid splash {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}) reduces the duration to 1 round.
06b7498d-ce9a-4c40-b54e-42d44fea1b08: At 10th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally V to his formula book as a 4th-level extract.
ae56edf1-865f-42de-bfc2-989c7cd26e87: At 10th level, an alchemist becomes completely immune to poison.
271de5de-d650-4d51-880a-8fc4ef2e0d15: At 14th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally VII to his formula book as a 5th-level extract.
e3e641f4-32fd-42ba-9c24-1bfdabfb191c: At 14th level, the effects of a mutagen last for 1 hour per level.
87a7723d-d7fe-4a49-b5d8-cb35015bbcca: At 18 level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally IX to his formula book as a 6th-level extract.
f5580f6c-d911-4749-9dbb-cc88084ae1b2:
At 1st level, an alchemist discovers how to create a mutagen that he can imbibe in order to heighten his physical prowess at the cost of his personality.
It's a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to drink a mutagen. Upon being imbibed, the mutagen causes the alchemist to grow bulkier and more bestial, granting him a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 alchemical bonus to the selected {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} for 10 minutes per alchemist level. In addition, while the mutagen is in effect, the alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to one of his mental ability scores. If the mutagen enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
0ae41413-078f-4c1b-abef-ace26568fb6a: At 20th level, the alchemist makes a grand discovery. For many alchemists, the promise of one of these grand discoveries is the primary goal of their experiments and hard work.
cb43c776-8f96-449e-8182-914cb635c3a1: At 2nd level, a chirurgeon's extracts of remove disease, remove blindness, neutralize poison, and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} automatically act as infusions and can be used not only on himself but on other people as well.
4ad006b6-8e00-4f41-b09a-4f6f3d43144c: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, in this case alchemist's fire. This {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} consumes the alchemical item, but transfers its effect to the weapon in question. The alchemical item takes full effect on the next creature struck by the weapon, but does not splash, spread, affect additional targets, or benefit from any other effects that specifically affect splash weapons. Any extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} added is not doubled on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The alchemical treatment causes no harm to the weapon treated, and wears off 1 minute after being applied if no blow is struck. Infusing a new alchemical item also removes the effect of any alchemical liquid or powder previously applied with this ability. At 6th level, a grenadier can use her alchemical weapon ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. At 15th level, this ability becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
e8bc682c-d547-4954-bae2-b55021ac26b3: At 2nd level, a grenadier can infuse a weapon or piece of ammunition with a single harmful alchemical liquid or powder, in this case an acid flask. 3d74d54a-fdbf-4b2d-b7a1-b5368780fdc1: At 2nd level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally I to his formula book as a 1st-level extract.
6315ebab-be54-4b81-b769-b3edf94d31db: At 2nd level, an alchemist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. This bonus increases to +4 at 5th level, and then again to +6 at 8th level. At 10th level, an alchemist becomes completely immune to poison.
7d020707-d508-4714-8469-60babf9aee38: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter (up to 18th level), a vivesectionist makes an incredible medical discovery. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the vivisectionist's level + the vivisectionist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
ad74828b-5fcc-4ab6-84d3-e8c4b85e605a: At 2nd level, and then again every 2 levels thereafter, an alchemist makes an incredible alchemical discovery. At 20th level, the alchemist makes an additional discovery. Unless otherwise noted, an alchemist cannot select an individual discovery more than once. Some discoveries can only be made if the alchemist has met certain prerequisites first, such as uncovering other discoveries. Only one such discovery can be applied to an individual bomb. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} called for by a discovery is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
419f9af9-a6e6-4ff6-93a5-4bd4cee5b56c: At 3rd level, a metamorph gains a 25% chance to negate {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, similar to the preserve organs discovery. This chance increases to 50% at 6th level, and to 75% at 18th level.
123e24d0-c733-49d5-9409-7f9b818c305c: At 5th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally II to his formula book as a 2nd-level extract.
8343b94e-fbbf-44af-a79b-ba5680f826f9: At 6th level, a grenadier can detonate a bomb so that it splashes in a 30-foot cone rather than affecting a radius. The cone starts at the alchemist and extends away from her in the direction she chooses. Each creature within the cone takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it had suffered a direct hit from the alchemist's bomb, but succeeding at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) halves the damage.
bb7f24cc-6de3-4195-95ad-26d1ca9ae958: At 8th level, a preservationist adds summon nature's ally IV to his formula book as a 3rd-level extract.
000a497f-c0c4-48d4-833a-15ea1328545e: Bombs are a special kind of {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} that most commonly hit an area. Bombs ignore some {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g}, so they have a better chance to hit then regular weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Bombs can inflict a large variety of effects, from {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, to blindness, to dispelling magical effects.
ff22f05a-d730-4171-9354-45d9ba1f24db:
Breath Weapon: 30-foot cone of cold.
Resistance: cold 20.
1db62b76-0541-4fc5-956e-781689ea9051:
Breath Weapon: 30-foot cone of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
fd12c424-ae01-4642-8fc8-462649dc89ca:

ce381233-680d-4434-92e2-7f8710d0458b:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
28315f7b-039c-4417-8f04-6d6259924a30:

Resistance: acid 20.
88e6a082-23da-455d-9ee6-f1d47308efe4:

044e8c63-771f-48de-a589-a7e6e655ae45:

Resistance: acid 20.

Breath Weapon: 80-foot line of electricity.
Resistance: electricity 20.
e266501d-9dd7-41ab-b47c-cc4f5b0b7277: Creatures that take a direct hit from a dispelling bomb are subject to a targeted dispel magic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the alchemist's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. This cannot be used to target a specific spell effect.
83bff626-f70b-45d2-b39d-f5464a537db4: Creatures with the nauseated condition experience stomach distress. Nauseated creatures are unable to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentrate{/g} on spells, or do anything else requiring attention. The only {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} such a character can take is a single {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} per turn.
54644f1f-eff3-43ab-af28-0b7cd6e249d3: Cursed Bomb — Curse of Feeble Body
7e287592-ba5d-4be6-8af4-df1c76cc99cc: Greater Mutagen that gives the alchemist a +6 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +4 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
87febf53-5044-465a-9abc-148844f80e5f: Grenadiers train to exercise their talents in the thick of battle, even when not under the influence of their mutagens. They learn methods of combining weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with their alchemical magic, and sacrifice skill with poisons in order to become more adept at using alchemical bombs or using alchemical items in conjunction with their martial skills. As an unusual side effect of their skill at handling bombs and alchemical items with increased speed, grenadiers master the ability to drink potions, elixirs, and mutagens quickly and safely, without exposing themselves to peril while doing so.
b057d230-ac08-4c76-9101-d3d3a5a7fd06:
In addition to magical extracts, alchemists are adept at swiftly mixing various volatile chemicals and infusing them with their magical reserves to create powerful bombs that they can hurl at their enemies. An alchemist can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an alchemist's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to the alchemist's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an alchemist's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered alchemist level. Splash damage from an alchemist bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of fire damage on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of fire damage). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's Intelligence modifier.
58fd36b9-6735-41bf-8bed-9d0f5cb60811: Incense fog area increases to 30 feet around incense synthesizer.
292bfdc3-1066-492d-ab98-350c219010db: Instead of dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, this bomb exposes creatures around it to choking gas. Creatures that take a direct hit or are in the splash area must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage the alchemist bomb would usually inflict. Creatures nauseated by this bomb can attempt another save each round.
fc517f26-ea40-4a83-9580-8534a9daea43: Instead of dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, this bomb exposes creatures around it to choking gas. Creatures that take a direct hit or are in the splash area must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or become nauseated[LONGSTART] for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage the alchemist bomb would usually inflict. Creatures nauseated by this bomb can attempt another save each round[LONGEND].
4df0cbe9-5e9b-4fd2-ae25-680b3d2c148b: Instead of drawing the components of, creating, and throwing a bomb, the alchemist can draw the components, drink them, mix them within his body, and then expel them as a breath weapon as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon is a 15-foot cone and has the same {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} as the bomb. Each creature within the cone takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it had suffered a direct hit from the alchemist's bomb, but succeeding at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} (DC = 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) halves the damage. Unlike throwing normal bombs, drawing, drinking, and expelling breath weapon bombs does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
0fb2d4a7-7d48-4650-9889-8e4491c9af7d: Metamorphs eschew traditional alchemy, focusing on internal chemistry and the transfiguration of living forms.
68c5f956-20ab-44c0-bc50-0372ec71a564:
On a direct hit, an alchemist's acid bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g}+5 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Splash {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from an alchemist bomb is always 8 damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} is 17.
Creatures that take a direct hit from an acid bomb take an additional 1d6 points of acid damage 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} later.
1c303a0a-9b9a-4a05-8b4d-f659fce378e6:
On a direct hit, an alchemist's blinding bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to the alchemist's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The damage of an alchemist's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered alchemist level[LONGSTART] (this bonus damage is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or by using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Vital Strike)[LONGEND]. Splash damage from an alchemist bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage[LONGSTART] (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of fire damage on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of fire damage). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the alchemist's level + the alchemist's Intelligence modifier[LONGEND].
Creatures that take a direct hit from a blinding bomb are blinded for 1 minute unless they succeed at a Fortitude save. Creatures in the splash area that fail their saves against the bomb are dazzled for 1 minute.

e5461dda-4f0b-4a53-8b1e-4ecb5c8dbadc:

26b9289b-bbe3-4058-9a74-485429a97d0c: Preservationist is an alchemist who keeps preserved specimens in bottles, and releases them to aid him in his battles.
3a729151-584f-4553-86a5-86cf618a25d8: Some alchemists focus their efforts on researching different kinds of incenses to aid them and their allies in battle against the forces of evil.
605708c7-3bda-4af7-9b8d-a72c74735bd8: The alchemist gains the ability to create a cognatogen, a mutagen-like mixture that heightens one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} at the expense of a physical ability score. If the cognatogen enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, it applies a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. If it enhances his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, it applies a penalty to his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}. Otherwise, this ability works just like the mutagen ability (including the natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}). Anytime the alchemist would prepare a mutagen, he may instead prepare a cognatogen. All limitations of mutagens apply to cognatogens as if they were the same substance — an alchemist can only maintain one mutagen or cognatogen at a time, a cognatogen that is not in an alchemist's possession becomes inert, drinking a cognatogen makes a non-alchemist sick, and so on. When the effect of the cognatogen ends, the alchemist takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to the ability score penalized by the cognatogen. The infuse mutagen discovery and the persistent mutagen class ability apply to cognatogens.
00d20a7f-2893-4459-9e66-a6ee0765ab6c: The alchemist gains the ability to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} from wounds rapidly. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, he can heal 5 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} as if he had the {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} ability. He can heal 5 hit points per day in this manner for every 2 alchemist levels he possesses.
b187fe2d-d8fe-47fa-addf-218042740629: The alchemist has mastered preserving flesh and applied this knowledge to his own body, turning himself into an undead-like creature. The alchemist's type does not change, but he becomes immune to cold, paralysis, and sleep.
a2a23ced-1fdd-4be2-8364-7972ee2ebdb7:
The alchemist learns how to preserve and protect his vital organs, reducing the chance of a mortal wound. When a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is scored on the alchemist, there is a 25% chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} normally.
This does not stack with similar abilities that negate critical hits and sneak attacks (such as fortification armor). An alchemist can take this discovery up to three times; the effects stack, increasing this chance to 50% and then 75%.
18581bfe-a75c-4f3f-8e78-eaadf6bbf3df: The alchemist's body is suffused with poison. Any creature that bites the alchemist must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be nauseated for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
5a80f6aa-fa8e-44cf-bb62-f4871ccd40a6: The alchemist's bombs now have a splash radius of 10 feet rather than 5 feet. Creatures that take a direct hit from an explosive bomb catch fire, taking {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} until the fire is extinguished.
15eecb6f-73b7-46e7-a423-c6a4ba8b7cab: The alchemist's cognatogen now grants a +4 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +6 alchemical bonus to one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}), and a +4 alchemical bonus to a second mental ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on both associated physical ability scores as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to both associated physical ability scores when the cognatogen ends.
c0abc639-974b-45ca-971b-a466e86dd1fd: The alchemist's cognatogen now grants a +6 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +8 alchemical bonus to one mental {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}), a +6 alchemical bonus to a second mental ability score, and a +4 alchemical bonus to a third mental ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} as long as the cognatogen persists, and takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} to each physical ability score when the cognatogen ends.
697c90b1-cdc5-4b7e-88e4-0d4085c0773a: The alchemist's constant exposure to strange chemicals has expanded his mind. His {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score permanently increases by 2 points.
fdd74b50-595f-4a9b-ab89-542d4b71e957: The alchemist's flesh responds to damage with shocking speed — he gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5.
7765f26a-a41e-40a6-be74-d156eb466570: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +4 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +6 alchemical bonus to one physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}), and a +4 alchemical bonus to a second physical ability score. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on both associated mental ability scores as long as the mutagen persists.
68e3b8a2-13cf-4075-8569-992fc610a698: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +6 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +8 alchemical bonus to one {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}), a +6 alchemical bonus to a second physical ability score, and a +4 alchemical bonus to a third physical ability score. 9e4b9014-572b-46a2-94bf-299a8b0aa187: The alchemist's mutagen now grants a +8 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +8 alchemical bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}. The alchemist takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} as long as the mutagen persists.
33e45c4d-8deb-45b9-a649-ae4ee66cd2e0: The alchemist's reputation is not softened by his exuberance (some would say dangerous recklessness) in perfecting his magical extracts and potion-like creations, infusing these substances with magic siphoned from his aura and using his own body as experimental stock. Nor is it mollified by the alchemist's almost gleeful passion for building explosive bombs and discovering strange new poisons and methods for their use. These traits, while making him a liability and risk for most civilized organizations and institutions of higher learning, seem to fit quite well with most adventuring groups.
12c32241-2c70-41de-bf70-be26ffb3a6f6: The infusion discovery allows an alchemist to use his extracts not only on himself but on other people as well. With this discovery, all alchemist extracts will behave exactly like {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of the same names when considering targets and range.
8d53e0bb-6b80-4b4f-bbd5-2dddce028c72: This is a special kind of potion that allows the alchemist to empower some of their abilities for the price of weakening the others. Mutagens serve to specialize the alchemist for a certain combat style, such as assault, defense, or ranged combat.
c86f8461-86fe-4d64-9a1f-a7eba77a9165: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as dragonkind I except that it also allows you to assume the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +6 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d8), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6), and one tail slap attack (1d8). You can only use the breath weapon twice per casting of this spell (when you use it, the duration of your breath weapon ability is reduced by 1/2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minutes), and you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 80-foot lines and cones increase to 40-foot cones.
47febb4d-6f99-4f91-b5ad-690a8f3cef63: Under the effects of feral mutagen the alchemist gains bat-like wings that give him a +3 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and immunity to the effects of difficult terrain.
dfd7af6e-cc0d-4393-8e80-364832e563c7:
When an alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it deliver one of the four powerful curses. A creature that takes a direct hit from a cursed bomb must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or be affected by one of the following curses:
Curse of Feeble Body — the subject suffers a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
Curse of Weakness — the subject suffers a -6 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} scores.
Curse of Idiocy — the subject suffers a -6 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores.
Curse of Deterioration — the subject suffers a -4 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, saves, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
e14025eb-4a18-47ee-8ec8-2ff9c6635859: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose for it to detonate very brightly. Creatures that take a direct hit from a blinding bomb are blinded for 1 minute unless they succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}. Creatures in the splash area that fail their saves against the bomb are dazzled for 1 minute.
9b0420fa-8be8-4f64-a118-a3ad0ef6ec85: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it deal good {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}divine damage{/g}. Evil creatures that take a direct hit from a holy bomb must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or be staggered on their next turn. Against neutral creatures, holy bombs deal half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and such targets are not affected by their staggering effect. Holy bombs have no effect on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} creatures.
ff55afca-d7a0-4035-9ee6-8ca569dcdc27: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it dispel magic effects instead of deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a dispelling bomb are subject to a targeted dispel magic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the alchemist's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. This cannot be used to target a specific spell effect.
84851a5d-86ec-4ed8-8ee1-64e7c6ad75fa: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from an acid bomb take an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} later.
d19a9a25-2689-4b19-b66c-f9ddcab3af11: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a frost bomb are staggered for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} unless they succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}.
f72a7765-611b-4df2-8f50-9efd6f672a88: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. Creatures that take a direct hit from a shock bomb are dazzled for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
7c64b176-dcdd-4f6f-b96c-396f5393a32d: When the alchemist creates a bomb, he can choose to have it inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}. Force bombs deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of force damage, plus 1d4 points of force damage for every odd-numbered level, instead of 1d6. Creatures that take a direct hit from a force bomb are knocked prone unless they succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g}.
a198b480-16a9-4a51-9ba9-415ac370871a: When the alchemist throws a bomb, it doesn't affect allies.
7812ab27-ff2c-4473-b3bf-f44090384ff7: When the alchemist throws a bomb, it doesn't affect their allies.
5a37bbdd-720f-4874-ba24-144e1cea4b5a: Whenever the alchemist imbibes a mutagen, he gains two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and a bite attack. These are primary attacks and are made using the alchemist's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. The claw attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 if the alchemist is Small) and the bite attack deals 1d8 points of damage (1d6 if the alchemist is Small). While the mutagen is in effect, the alchemist gains a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} when used to intimidate.
5d4772ba-d3cf-435f-ac7a-5103e8ac76c4:
You become a Large bear. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, one 1d6 bite attack, and the rend ability.
Rend: When a bear hits an opponent with both its claws, it deals an additional 1d6 plus 1–1/2 times its Strength modifier points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g}. It can only deal this additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
cc04b2e8-6169-4f75-bdf4-cc3c3199a50c:
You become a Large shambling mound. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 20, and resist electricity 20. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, the constricting vines ability, and the poison ability.
Constricting Vines: A shambling mound's vines coil around any creature it hits with a slam attack. The shambling mound attempts a grapple {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} against its target, and on a successful check its vines deal 2d6+5 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and the foe is grappled.
Grappled characters cannot move, and take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all attack rolls and a -4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Grappled characters attempt to escape every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a successful combat maneuver, Strength, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this check is the shambling mound's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}.
Each round, creatures grappled by a shambling mound suffer (4d6 + twice the Strength modifier) damage.
A shambling mound receives a +4 bonus on grapple maneuver checks.
Poison:
Slam; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/round for 2 rounds
Effect: 1d2 Strength and 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Dexterity damage{/g}
Cure: 1 save
The save DC is Constitution-based.
